greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of digits of 4^n.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = A007953(A000302(n)). - _Michel Marcus_, Nov 01 2013 [corrected by _Georg Fischer_, Dec 19 2020]
a(n) = A001370(2n). Results given there imply a(n) > log_4(n) + 1/2, n > 0, but we can conjecture & expect a(n) ~ 9*log_10(2)*n. - _M. F. Hasler_, May 18 2017
program: (PARI) SumD(x)= { local(s=0); while (x>9, s+=x-10*(x\10); x\=10); return(s + x) } { for (n=0, 1000, a=SumD(4^n); write("b065713.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 27 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 11 2001
